ygData.subject: Re: At the cave
ygData.msgSnippet: Aracnia looked to Cyber Claw with caution in her optics, Calm down, the bots who let you in were kitkat and Drillbit. Dont be concerned with them, not yet.

    Aracnia looked to Cyber Claw with caution in her optics, "Calm down, the 
bots who let you in were kitkat and Drillbit. Dont be concerned with them, 
not yet." Turning, she could hear Dark Mouses cries from the other room.
    If Aracnia could do one thing good, it was to hold a grudge. That little 
vermine was a deserter, she left Aracnia without so much as telling anyone 
else. Bots like those had one fate in the Predacons......death. Slow and 
painful. Of course she didnt intend to kill her little mouse, not at all, 
actually she was going to let her dangle on her hook until she came running 
back to Aracnia. Then Aracnia would inform her of what ahppens to treachorus 
Predacons....and tell her that she was no better than Megatron. That would 
send anybot into a downward spiral of self hate and depression. Aracnia 
frowned......what a waste of liquid energone too.
    "So, Kitkat, as I was saying......Our groups should unite. Under your 
direction of course. Im willing to comply with you so that the Predacons can 
once agian be united. If you want to come to my base and check that out it 
can be arranged, anything you need I shall provide you with." Black Aracnia 
said, tring to ignore that idiot Starscreams rants and raves about her true 
intentions......bots like those got an even worse death than deserters....
    Aracnia smiled, a rare event, "Will you require time to think about this, 
Commander?"

    Nighteyes limped through the forest, turning at Aracnia cruiser. Mech 
fluid was pouring out of her like a fountian. Megatron had shot her in the 
thigh.....and she needed a CR chamber. Hell Beast cast her out for being a 
female, and said it would lead to internal conflict. The closest base was 
Kitkats.....and she knew she would be recived very well, but death was apon 
her like the sunset was apon the land.
    She got to the door, and fell, scratching her claws agianst the door. 
"Help, please! S.O.S.! Help me, someone!" She cried in vain....time was 
short, and she began to feel light headed.
